text:
(1)
Remsen Street, west from Court Street, showing part of the corner building which housed Hooley's Opera House, in 1861 or 1862. The Dime Savings Bank, organized in 1859, occupied this site from 1884.

About 1882.

Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

(2)
The same, showing the corner. Now (1936) a 23-story building occupies this site.
About 1915.

Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

Court Street, west side, between Remsen and Joralemon Streets. A view across Borough Hall Park in which is erected a statue to Henry Ward Beecher. At the left is a section of Borough Hall.

1910.

Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

Remsen Street, south side, near Court Street, showing several brownstone houses that are to be converted into offices of the Brooklyn Union Gas Co.

1923.

Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

Remsen Street, west from, and including Court Street. Also seen is Court Street, from, but not including Montague Street, to, but not including Joralemon Street. In the extreme right, is the Old Phenix Insurance Building, now gone; the new building is 16 Court Street. In the extreme left, is the front of the Brooklyn Municipal building, and the top part of it showing the clock tower still functioning.

May 1926.

Brown Brothers.

Celebrations, Parades: Firemen marching to the Borough Hall in Brooklyn. The view is west on Remsen Street from Court Street. View 2 shows a firemen's funeral procession down Lexington Ave., Manhattan.

1930's
Views 1,2
title: Celebrations - Parades - Municipal events - Fireman's Parade - Brooklyn.
